I’m Kamiye Oladipo Ojedokun, a Quality Assurance Engineer dedicated to delivering flawless software and exceptional user experiences. With a foundation rooted in problem-solving and analytical thinking, my journey into QA has been driven by a fascination with how technology shapes human interaction

Although my background was initially in web development, I discovered my true passion for software quality assurance through self‑directed learning and hands-on experience. Over the years, I’ve gained extensive expertise in both manual and automated testing, ensuring that every product I work on is not only bug-free but also meets the highest standards of performance, reliability, and user experience.

My work starts with strong fundamentals in Manual Testing, where I validate features through Functional, Regression, Integration, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT). I enjoy digging into real user scenarios—testing edge cases, unusual inputs, and hidden flows—to ensure a product doesn’t just “work,” but works consistently across different conditions. To keep my testing structured and traceable, I document everything using Qase.io and Microsoft Excel, creating clear test plans, test cases, and execution reports that teams can rely on.

As projects grow, I lean into Automated Testing to increase speed and confidence during releases. Using tools like Selenium, Playwright, and Cypress, I build test scripts that cover high-impact user journeys—especially the areas that break most during product updates. I’m also comfortable writing test logic and custom utilities with Python and JavaScript, which helps me extend testing beyond basic checks into smarter validations and reusable frameworks.



I don’t just test interfaces—I also test what powers them. With API Testing using Postman, I validate responses, status codes, payload accuracy, and system behavior behind the scenes. When bugs appear, I document them with the clarity developers need to fix them fast, using Jira and Bugzilla for defect tracking, prioritization, and retesting. I work comfortably in Agile/Scrum environments, adapting quickly to sprint timelines, shifting requirements, and continuous improvement cycles.

I also understand how modern teams ship software today, which is why I’m familiar with integrating tests into pipelines using Jenkins and GitHub Actions. I use Git and GitHub for version control, and I apply SQL when I need to validate data, confirm records, or verify backend changes. For me, QA isn’t just about catching bugs—it’s about protecting the user experience, supporting product quality, and helping teams deliver with confidence.
